metadata.synopsis: Councilor Florrick is working in secret for a dragon in the city of Baldur's Gate. She is acting as an advisor to Grand Duke Ravengard. She should come across as good but no nonsense. SHe is used to getting her way.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -58, 5864. Destroy the barrel blocking the doorway.5. Go to the floor above and free the woman trapped behind the door.She will run out and the dialogue will commence.

167.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
167.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
167.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
79.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

109.speaker: Wyll
109.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
109.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

83.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
83.text: Wyll - by the Maimed God, what's become of you?
83.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: A story best left for calmer days. Now breathe deeply - are you in pain?

9.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
9.text: A scorched throat, a few hairs singed off. Nothing a bit of time and fresh air can't cure.

24.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
24.text: Gauntlet, a new duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.

35.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
35.text: Report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: No, it can't be. You mean, they've taken -

119.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
119.text: Yes, Wyll. The drow have your father.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Wyll, you are the son of nobility?

156.speaker: Wyll
156.text: The circumstance of my birth is no matter of pride for neither me nor my father.

3.speaker: Wyll
3.text: But pride is no reason to refuse help to my own flesh and blood. How can we help?

165.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
165.text: Rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. Baldur's Gate needs him now, more than ever.

40.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
40.text: As well you should. He is the great champion of the Council, commander of the Flaming Fist - the binding force holding Baldur's Gate together.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Ravengard? I don't know the name.

14.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
14.text: He is the great champion of the Council, commander of the Flaming Fist - the binding force holding Baldur's Gate together.

1.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
1.text: Without him, the city faces collapse. In fact, I fear that may have been the intention of those who abducted him.

161.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
161.text: Wyll, you must hold little love for your father. But please, find him and return him to the city.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: A Grand Duke, you say? And what is his rescue worth to you?

26.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
26.text: I'll empty every last of the Council of Four's coffers, if I must.

48.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
48.text: Wyll, you must hold little love for your father. But please, find him and return him to the city. Baldur's Gate needs him now, more than ever.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: Trust us to see it through, Counsellor.

70.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
70.text: Fist Ito, a new duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.

157.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
157.text: Fist Aelis, a new duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.

140.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
140.text: Fist Pavel, a new duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.

17.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
17.text: Listen, Wyll - the drow have taken Grand Duke Ravengard.

67.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
67.text: Yes, Wyll. They have your father.

62.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
62.text: Wyll, by the living gods! I couldn't have asked for a finer saviour.
62.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

106.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
106.text: Thank you so - no, it can't be. Wyll, by the living gods, what's happened to you?
106.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

153.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
153.text: Thank you so - no, it can't be. Wyll, by the living gods, what's happened to you?

170.speaker: Player
170.text: A story best left for calmer days, Counsellor.

163.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
163.text: Calmer days are not soon to come, Wyll - as I'm sure you know.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Let's just say I got mixed up with the wrong crowd.

73.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
73.text: Yes. As Ravengard told me, where his son treads, the Hells fires are sure to burn.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: That's my business, and no one else's.

44.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
44.text: I won't press for answers you won't give.

126.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
126.text: Wyll, by the living gods! I couldn't have asked for a finer saviour.
126.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

96.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
96.text: Wyll, by the living gods! I couldn't have asked for a finer saviour.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *She is a ghost from your past come to haunt you - Counsellor Florrick, your father's closest confidante, and a loyal servant of Baldur's Gate.*

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - the man you call your father. The man who cast you from your home after pacting with Mizora.*

18.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
18.text: Wyll, you must hold little love for your father. But please, find him and return him to the city. Baldur's Gate needs him now, more than ever.

25.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
25.text: Listen, Wyll - the drow have taken Grand Duke Ravengard.

53.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
53.text: A story best left for calmer days. Now breathe deeply - are you in pain?
53.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: A story best left for calmer days. Now breathe deeply - are you in pain?

45.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
45.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?
45.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

104.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
104.text: A scorched throat, a few hairs singed off. Nothing a bit of time and fresh air can't cure.

134.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
134.text: Yes, Wyll. The drow have your father.

12.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
12.text: Listen, Wyll - the drow have taken Grand Duke Ravengard.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: No, it can't be. You mean, they've taken -

107.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
107.text: Yes, Wyll. They have your father.

128.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
128.text: Wyll, you must hold little love for your father. But please, find him and return him to the city.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Whoever holds my father is my target. I'll head west and find them - trust me to see it through.

32.speaker: Player
32.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

80.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
80.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

7.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
7.text: Your boldness is a blessing - I'm in your debt.
7.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

137.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
137.context: NodeContext: Briushes herself off. Yeva pronounced Yay-va.

145.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
145.text: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Yeva.
145.context: NodeContext: Briushes herself off. Yeva pronounced Yay-va.

86.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
86.text: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Ito.

110.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis
110.context: NodeContext: Brushes herself off. Aelis = Ay-liss.

74.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
74.text: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Aelis.
74.context: NodeContext: Brushes herself off. Aelis = Ay-liss.

0.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
0.text: It takes more than mere fire to break me, Pavel.

6.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
6.text: Now listen close, fist: duty calls. Drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears can be believed.

78.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
78.text: Gauntlet - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.

142.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
142.text: The rest of you - count the dead. Take word of their sacrifice to the city.

122.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
122.text: And you - I must ask again for your aid.

64.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
64.text: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.

115.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
115.text: May I trust you'll see it through?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Why entrust this to me? You have others at your command.

168.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
168.text: Isn't it clear? The Blade is known for action. Who might I trust, if not a legend? Who might rise to the moment, if not Ravengard's own son?

166.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
166.text: Isn't it clear? You travel with the Blade of Frontiers. Who might I trust, if not a legend? Who might rise to the moment, if not Ravengard's own son?

88.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
88.text: By the time aid arrives, it might be too late. You've the heart of a dragon and the will of a hero. Tell me I can count on you.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: The drow took the Duke to Moonrise Towers.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Goblins take their prisoners to Moonrise Towers. That's where we'll find the duke.

169.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
169.text: Moonrise Towers? Along the old road? That place is cursed. Few could survive there...

57.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
57.text: ... unless darker forces are at work.

47.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
47.text: This was no random attack. The Grand Duke was their target.

91.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
91.text: Thank you. When the Grand Duke returns to the city, he'll hail his only son a hero.

130.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
130.text: Go. You should pick up the drow trail with ease.

51.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
51.text: I will seek reinforcements and join you when I can.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Remember, Wyll. 'Courage is found in the battle against fear, not in the defeat of it.'

71.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
71.text: Remember, Wyll. 'Courage is found in the battle against fear, not in the defeat of it.'

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: So father said. I won't soon forget.

76.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
76.text: Thank you. And should your courage falter, remember the Duke's generosity.

124.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
124.text: Approach the Towers with care - the land itself has been swallowed in shadow.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You'll need to find him without my help - I've done all I can for now.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Damn you. My father's in danger. We cannot turn our backs.

179.speaker: Wyll
179.text: Damn you. My father's in danger. We cannot turn our backs.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I see the Blade's goodwill has limits. Far be it from me to stretch them.

13.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
13.text: I see your goodwill has limits. Far be it from me to stretch them.

98.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
98.text: Should you hear word of Ravengard, seek me out. I will not fly far.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: The Absolute's cult is based at Moonrise Towers. That's where they'll have taken the duke.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: The Absolute's cult is based at Moonrise Towers. That's where they'll have taken the duke.

29.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
29.text: The invisible force holding Baldur's Gate together. Without him, the city's collapse is certain.

39.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
39.text: I fear that may have been the intention of those who abducted him.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: A duke? I owe no fealty to the nobles of this world.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: A duke? I owe no fealty to the nobles of the upper world.

118.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
118.text: It is not fealty I ask, merely a great favour on behalf of my city.

90.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
90.text: Grand Duke Ravengard is the invisible force holding Baldur's Gate together.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Ravengard's a champion to the people of Baldur's Gate.

28.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
28.text: A champion, indeed. He's the invisible force holding Baldur's Gate together.

94.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
94.text: Without him, the city faces collapse. In fact, I fear that may have been the intention of those who abducted him.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I owe no fealty to some Upper City toff.

105.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
105.text: It is not fealty I ask, but a great favour on behalf of our city.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'll rescue Duke Ravengard. You have my word.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You'll have to find somebody else for the job.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I have no duty to nobles, dukes, or anyone. Anything for that matter.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: On my oath: I will see Duke Ravengard rescued, and his captors vanquished.

2.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
2.text: Ito - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.

151.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
151.text: Aelis - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.

4.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
4.text: Pavel - report to the manip and send for reinforcements. We must find the Duke.

176.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
176.text: Listen close: drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears may be believed.

16.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
16.text: I must report to the Flaming Fist manip, with haste.

174.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
174.text: We can talk when you get me out of here!
